content.description: Start on a side pull on the arete. Follow the arete up to the top.
content.location: Left and behind from Donkey Show boulder.

content.description: Start as for Bubba's Got a Gun.  Crush a powerful move up and left into a pocket from the sloping ledge. (Yellow line in picture)
content.location: On the "Bubba Boulder" (Roughly 12 feet tall). If you are standing on the trail looking at "The Donkey Show", the boulder is just to the left and behind the Donkey Show Boulder.

content.description: Start with a right hand on the arete and a left hand undercling.
From Bruised Banana Hammock's starting hold, traverse right and finish on Whateverest. (Red line in picture)
content.location: On the "Bubba Boulder" (Roughly 12 feet tall). If you are standing on the trail looking at "The Donkey Show", the boulder is just to the left and behind the Donkey Show Boulder.

content.description: From Bruised Banana Hammock's starting hold, traverse right and finish on Bubba's Got a Gun.  Guidebook says V5, but feel free to form your own opinion. (Pink line in picture)
content.location: On the "Bubba Boulder" (Roughly 12 feet tall). If you are standing on the trail looking at "The Donkey Show", the boulder is just to the left and behind the Donkey Show Boulder.

content.description: Sit-start matched on big sidepull feature and go up to sloping ledge.  Traverse right and finish on arete. (Green line in picture)
content.location: On the "Bubba Boulder" (Roughly 12 feet tall). If you are standing on the trail looking at "The Donkey Show", the boulder is just to the left and behind the Donkey Show Boulder. See beta picture.

content.description: Sit-start on big left-facing sidepull and go up through small dihedral. (Blue line in picture)
content.location: On the "Bubba Boulder" (Roughly 12 feet tall). If you are standing on the trail looking at "The Donkey Show", the boulder is just to the left and behind the Donkey Show Boulder.

content.description: See approach for Donkey Show Boulder.  This boulder is just downhill from the Donkey show boulder, and the climbs are mostly on the east side of the boulder.
